citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS), Oil Spill Administration Office
citeinfo.title: Aerial Bird Surveys

descript.abstract: Data Type: Birds; This theme includes survey design and data for aerial surveys of migratory birds for Prince William Sound and the Kenai Peninsula. It includes: 1) random sample areas used for population estimates, 2) a complete coastal survey performed in 1989, and 3) historical data compiled by Haddock in 1971. The primary purpose of this theme was to analyze data for changes in populations following the spill. Scale is 1:63,360.

idinfo.accconst: Data transfer costs will be based on staff time and media costs.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
